info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 9:14PM MST until August 25 at 12:15AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 1215 AM MST. * At 914 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated numerous thunderstorms producing heavy rain across most of southwest Mohave County. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Topock, Mohave Valley, Cattail Cove State Park, Desert Hills. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
